content:
Hi everyone! First time using Zulip and just starting to learn Rust. I come from a JS background, so its quite a different world here! I'm currently reading the rustlang book and now I'm looking ways to get into Rust by contributing but I don't know where to start. Is there any work group for starters? I have years of experience as a dev, mostly front end.
Thanks!
Hi! If you want to get involved, you should take a look at the issues labeled E-easy and E-mentor. Also take a look at the rustc-dev-guide if you want to hack on the compiler!
@Jorge Venegas you can ping me i can find you some issues to work on :slight_smile:

It's more JS than Rust, but if you find it interesting, there's a bit of work to be done for https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/144729-wg-traits/topic/.22skill.20tree.22/near/192200144 (see https://rust-lang.github.io/wg-traits/roadmap/skill-tree.html for a sample). It's totally fine if it's too exotic or you'd rather try something else, though.
Thanks a lot for the pointers and offered help, guys :) this is very useful!
